name: Seswaa
description: Shredded beef or goat meat, slow-cooked and seasoned with salt.

name: Pap (Bogobe)
description: Thick maize meal porridge, often served with meat or vegetables.

name: Morogo (Wild Spinach)
description: Leafy green vegetable, similar to spinach, often boiled or saut√©ed.

name: Dikgobe
description: Mixture of samp (crushed maize) and beans, cooked together.

name: Vetkoek
description: Deep-fried dough bread, often stuffed with mince or jam.

name: Madila
description: Fermented sour milk or yogurt, rich in probiotics.

name: Motogo
description: Soft fermented sorghum porridge, usually eaten for breakfast.

name: Bogobe ba leletse
description: Sour porridge made from fermented sorghum or maize, served thin and warm.

name: Swii (Traditional Sweets)
description: Sweetened snacks often made from sugar, syrup, or local fruits.

name: Biltong
description: Dried, cured meat, typically beef or game, seasoned with spices.

name: Boerewors
description: Traditional South African sausage made from minced meat, spices, and herbs.
